comments.author: Gary Funk
comments.message:
I've been using SQLyog for MySQL for as long as I can remember. It servers me well and has helped me solve many a problem.

I'll take a look at Navicat as I'm always looking for new tools.

comments.author: Akbarsait
comments.message: @Gary I’m sure you will like Navicat over SQLyog!

comments.author: Nick Sophinos
comments.message: Yeah, I have been using Navicat on my Mac since 2006 and it is smooth.

comments.author: Raul Riera
comments.message: I switched from navicat lite to http://www.sequelpro.com/ it's pretty good! lots of features not included in navicat and it is open source (and very "cute" ui)

comments.author: Charlie Griefer
comments.message: I've been a happy Sequel Pro user as well.  Altho recently Todd Sharp turned me on to mySQL Workbench (http://wb.mysql.com/).  I've downloaded it, but haven't taken it for a test drive yet.  Looking forward to doing so, as it sounds very impressive.

comments.author: Jeff Pierson
comments.message: I have also been using Navicat for about 2 years now.  It has served me well and met my needs so far.

comments.author: Akbarsait
Gary Funk
comments.message:
@Charlie: I've been using MySQL Workbench since it was first in beta. It's really nice. 

@Akbarsait: I tried Navicat and while it's nice, SQLyog has so many more features and is the most powerful MySQL tool I have found.

comments.author: Rick Mason
comments.message: I actually had to use Navicat at my last job and really prefer SQLYog.  My only beef with them is that they have yet to introduce a version for the Mac where I am spending more of my time these days.

comments.author: Website Design Ltd
comments.message: I have just started to use Navicat, it looks real good so far; do you have any useful Navicat resources (espically on implementing many to many relationships using multiple foreign keys as a primary key?)

comments.author: TheOddOne
comments.message:
When it comes down to database editing and data editing (not running, backup etc) MySQL Workbench is a pile of crap. (Try edit a blob ("Text" rather) in table edit mode)

SQLyog is better.

Navicat is the betterest!
(If it supported MS-SQL I would use it at work)

comments.author: jorjes
comments.message:
Not so far I have found new cool tool to work with mySQL - Valentina Studio. Its free edition can do things more than many commercial tools!!
I very recommend check it.   http://www.valentina-db.com/en/valentina-studio-overview

comments.author: Joesph
comments.message: My only beef with them is that they need nonetheless to introduce a version for the mack where i am spending a lot of of my time currently I actually had to use Navicat at my last job and extremely like SQLYog.
